pros: Very much a team environment! Wonderful people to work with and everyone is so helpful.
cons: Small company so insurance is high.

review_title: Apply if you want horror stories about working for the CEO
pros: Good co workers most of the time while they last
cons:
1-The lack of respect the CEO has for the people they hire. They fire people for made up reasons so they don't have to pay for insurance and when you some how some way make it past the 90 days they make up lies as to why you don't have insurance because they are too cheap to pay for insurance.
2-The workload is super unrealistic. No one has there known office and intakes were done in the kitchen; more than once might I add despite us staying we don't have any rooms open to give the clients brave enough to seek services the respect they deserve.
3-The offices are bad. Super small and they always overbook and don't know how to schedule.
4-The reasons the CEO discharges clients are EVIL. A client gives them an attitude DISCHARGED. The client's kid is annoying? DISCHARGED? 
5-The lies the CEO told me while I was working there made me ill. My anxiety was through the roof and I went to ED once because of it. When I was fired due to "down sizing", even though they hired all new people that I saw on their website, I was so thankful because I free and my anxiety was gone.

pros: You will learn how to navigate extremely toxic and stressful working conditions while maintaining a therapeutic and consistent presence for your clients.
cons: There are many cons and it will be difficult to fit them into a review: the hire and fire rate is beyond what I have ever experienced, approximately 25 people in 7 months. The communication is toxic, punitive and  blaming to staff members without acknowledgement of the lack of training or clear expectations. Caseloads can reach up as high as 55 people to be seen in a 40 hour work week. The owner refers to herself as a CEO and is not present physically or emotionally enough to accept responsibility for her short comings. The benefits are mentioned but never formally offered, people have to chase and bother upper management to sign up for insurance and then many are fired before they can use it or continuously go without it for months without explanation. Many people have signed up for the 401k match and never received their match money. Many programs are offered that do not exist, clients appointments are canceled frequently or without notice. There are too many to list.

pros: I love working for Perspectives!! I’ve been with the agency for almost 2 years and honestly can’t imagine working anywhere else! My last full time position was with a corporate company where I was just a number, not cared about, and never felt appreciated. I’m part of a team and family at Perspectives. I can recall multiple phone calls that I’ve received from the CEO thanking me and acknowledging the work I’ve done. The CEO is compassionate, understating, driven, and motivated. It’s a company with great balance between being flexible and needing to get your job done and stay on top of your own responsibilities.
cons: This is not really a con but it is a job. You have to do your work and follow the rules to keep your job.

pros: Had great therapist and excellent referral source.
cons: This agency lacked respect for their employees and clients. They advertised programs that did not even exist or where never implemented. It was not welcoming neither child friendly. They fired employees without any specific reason. The owner was not receptive and was not willing to accept and embrace diversity. The place did not have a human resources and  no type of structure or organization. Did not offer praise and did not offer professional development.

pros: Doing what you love with a diverse client base
cons: Toxic work environment, constantly walking on eggshells worrying if you will be fired. I watched at least 10+ employees be let go (most without reason) in a short period of time. No structure, lack of empathy for clients who lose their clinicians and have to switch constantly. I do not recommend this environment for anyone looking to progress in their career.

review_title: This Agency will ruin your reputation

cons: Everything.  I would give them a negative rating, less than 0.  They fire everyone before they have to pay benefits on your behalf, (90 days).  There sites are unkept and they are unethical.  The NASW and other authorities should be looking into this agency
